result.execSummary:
The defendant Somer Lynn Sampson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Courts Office - Payment plan of $10 per month beginning on 05/01/2015 and the first of every month thereafter until paid in full.

No contact with Dustin Carroll, Alexandra Love and Fred Tourville.  
No controlled substances unless a valid prescription.

Must go to PCJ today (8/24/16) to speak with the jail nurse to sign releases.
NOT subject to Good Time.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Frederick A Bechtold in court.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Somer Lynn Sampson not in court. NE-Clerk 11:38. Ct DEF having issues w/getting a hold of Probation to appear today - and gives status. Ct an order of extension has been signed. 11:40 adj.
from DOC to MEG re jail time - to be extended until Status Hearing
Status hearing on November 28, 2016 at 11:30 am.
from Judge GaleWyrick to parties granting DOC's request to extend Defendant's date to report to jail
from DOC to Judge GaleWyrick requesting an extension for Defendant to report to jail

14CF286, 15CF391 Defendant Somer Lynn Sampson in court with attorney Frederick A Bechtold.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 910am 15CF391 C. A. S&T. A. S. S&T.  SENTENCING on Ct 2: 3.5 yrs I/S-  1.5 IC, 2 ES,  prob 3 yrs, 180 days jail banked for use of agent, not elig CIP, elig SAP, $290.60 fine/cost,   No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. comply w/services with CCCW, cannot choose own care provider, AODA & comply, DNA sample & surcharge, Absolute Sobriety. 943am adj. 

1101am 14CF286 SERH- 5 mos jail in jail- to begin serving no later than 9/23/16 at 5pm- go to jail today to speak to jail nurse to sign releases. not subject to GT. 60 DTP any fines still owing, if any. 1117am adj.

Defendant Somer Lynn Sampson in court.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BJM-clerk 1:10 pm  Def missed Probation review hearing on 9/22 - didn't have a ride.  CT quashes warrant.  Def to notify Probation re appearance today. 1:14 pm adj.

Somer called, unable to get to hearing - person giving ride fell through. Told her to contact prob as well.
Probation review hearing at 09-22-2015 08:30 am
amended.

CT - Ct. 1 to be amended to misd.  Def - G plea as to amended Ct 1.  CT accepts plea, find Def G & enters JOC.  CT - Ct 2 dismissed outright.

Defendant Somer Lynn Sampson in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KK Clerk 10:03AM  Atty Biller and Client waivers time limits for prelim hearing.  Court - Bond continues.  adj. 10:09AM  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Back on record 10:35AM.  All appearance as noted prior.  Atty Biller and client waives prelim hearing.  Court - finds the defendant FVKI waives prelim hearing. Def is bound over for further proceedings.  Arraignment will be done later today.  DA will file file information.  adj.  10:37AM

Back on Record 11:25AM Information filed.  All appearance as noted prior.  Def enters plea of NG to charges.  Court - bond continues.  adj.  11:26AM

Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Must appear at all future court appearances.    Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.
